datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to plays, acting, and stage performances.

columns.name: uses_special_effects
columns.description: Indicates whether the play uses special effects

columns.name: average_scene_complexity
columns.description: Average complexity score of scenes within the play, judged on factors such as stage setup, number of simultaneous actors, and scene changes

columns.name: venue_capacity
columns.description: Seating capacity of the venue where the play is performed.

columns.name: holiday_season
columns.description: Indicates whether the performance is during a holiday season

columns.name: duration_in_minutes
columns.description: Total duration of the play in minutes.

columns.name: set_changes_per_scene
columns.description: Number of set changes each scene undergoes in a play

columns.name: live_music_present
columns.description: Indicates if live music is present in the play

columns.name: set_complexity
columns.description: Complexity level of the set design, rated from 1 to 10.

columns.name: average_role_experience_years
columns.description: Average years of experience required for roles in the play

columns.name: has_sponsorship
columns.description: Indicates whether the play has financial sponsorship.

columns.name: has_special_effects
columns.description: Indicates if the play includes special effects

columns.name: target_audience_family
columns.description: Indicates if the play is targeted primarily towards families and children

columns.name: number_of_cast_members
columns.description: The total number of cast members participating in the play.

columns.name: scene_complexity_index
columns.description: A numerical index rating the complexity of scenes in a play from simple (minimal props and effects) to complex (numerous props and special effects)

columns.name: play_genre
columns.description: Genre of the play

columns.name: number_of_complex_roles
columns.description: Count of complex roles in the play that require extensive prop usage or special skills

columns.name: director_experience_years
columns.description: Number of years the director has been directing plays.

columns.name: special_effects_percentage
columns.description: Percentage of scenes containing special effects

columns.name: percentage_outdoor_scenes
columns.description: Percentage of scenes within a play that are set outdoors, typically requiring simpler setups.

columns.name: theme_historical
columns.description: Indicates if the play has a historical theme.

columns.name: average_scene_duration
columns.description: Average duration of scenes in minutes for a play

columns.name: has_intermission
columns.description: Indicates whether the play has an intermission or not

columns.name: weekly_rehearsal_hours
columns.description: Average number of rehearsal hours per week for the current production

columns.name: audience_interaction
columns.description: Indicates if the play includes elements of audience interaction

columns.name: lead_actor_experience
columns.description: Captures the number of years of experience the lead actor has

columns.name: licensed_content
columns.description: Indicates if the material is adapted from licensed content such as books or movies

columns.name: total_costume_changes
columns.description: Total number of costume changes throughout the play

columns.name: past_success_count
columns.description: Total number of previously successful plays by the theater group

columns.name: play_duration_minutes
columns.description: Duration of the play in minutes

columns.name: total_cast_members
columns.description: Total number of cast members in the play

columns.name: lead_actor_availability_days
columns.description: Total days the lead actor is available to perform in a week

columns.name: set_complexity_score
columns.description: Score representing the complexity of the set design, higher values indicate more complex designs

columns.name: percentage_technology_used_scenes
columns.description: Percentage of scenes within a play that employ advanced technological effects, such as digital projections or automation.

columns.name: season_of_production
columns.description: Season in which the play is produced

columns.name: story_complexity_rating
columns.description: Rating of the storyline complexity on a scale from 1 to 5

columns.name: promotional_discount
columns.description: Percentage discount offered on tickets for promotional purposes

columns.name: original_content
columns.description: Indicates if the material is originally written for the stage

columns.name: number_of_performance_days
columns.description: Total number of days over which the play is performed.

columns.name: has_live_music
columns.description: Indicates whether the play features live music performances

columns.name: historical_accuracy_focus
columns.description: Indicates if the production has a strong focus on historical accuracy

columns.name: number_of_actors
columns.description: Total number of actors involved in the play

columns.name: special_guest_appearance
columns.description: Indicates whether there is a special guest appearing in the play

columns.name: day_of_week
columns.description: Day of the week the play is performed, affecting scene transitions due to varying audience sizes and expectations

queries.question: Is there a relationship between the day of the week a play is scheduled and the lead actor's availability, special guest appearance, holiday season, and promotional discount in theater productions?
queries.true_hypothesis: Plays are scheduled on Saturday if the lead actor is available for more than 5 days and if the calculated performance score based on lead actor availability, special guest appearance, holiday season, and promotional discount exceeds 500; otherwise, plays are scheduled on Wednesday.
queries.true_hypothesis_expr: np.where((df['lead_actor_availability_days'] > 5) & ((df.apply(lambda row: (100 if row['special_guest_appearance'] == True else 50) + (80 if row['holiday_season'] == True else 30) + row['promotional_discount'], axis=1)) > 500), 'Saturday', 'Wednesday')
